26aee75d-dd2e-420e-a4da-c98fe22862aa.description: This badge acknowledges the completion of safety training for College of Engineering, IT and Environment laboratories located at Charles Darwin University. The training covers: emergency contacts; what to do during an emergency; what to do during an accident and medical attention; virtual laboratory tour; and risk assessment. Only students and visitors with this badge are entitled to carry out activities, experiments and practicals in the College’s laboratories.
26aee75d-dd2e-420e-a4da-c98fe22862aa.name: CEITE Lab Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in online learning activities and complete learning materials.
Successfully complete the online assessment about basic laboratory safety and risk assessment.

skills.name: Awareness Of Safety Rules For Laboratories

64ad5cfc-68a5-444c-a316-a742de77f98b.description: This micro-mode study offers an introductory-level of understanding in the Yolŋu languages and culture of east Arnhemland. It equips you with a basic understanding of Yolŋu language grammar, vocabulary, and pronunciation and their culture encompassing kinship, land, songlines, and history. The completion of this study will lead you toward the intermediate level of Yolŋu languages and cultural learnings.
64ad5cfc-68a5-444c-a316-a742de77f98b.name: Introduction to Yolŋu Languages and Culture

badge_template_activities.title: 6 weeks classroom participation: Internal students – CDU Casuarina campus; External students – CDU Learnline.
2 translation tasks:1st assignment – Translate a short story written in Gupapuyŋu Dhuwala’mirri language into English:  2nd assignment – Introduce your family in Gupapuyŋu Dhuwala’mirri language.

96b2165e-c214-4850-a5ca-2b859a5fa1e4.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the 3D Printing II training. Working on a guided intermediate level project, the earner of this badge gained knowledge of features, parameters and materials used in 3D printing. The earner was able to assess a designed part to ensure it fits within printer constraints and apply an understanding of 3D printing software settings (e.g. infill, layer height) to best create specified features and print a 3D component.
96b2165e-c214-4850-a5ca-2b859a5fa1e4.name: 3D Printing Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Assess a designed part to ensure it fits within printer constraints
Identify and rectify possible print issues through inspection of a print preview or simulation
Apply an understanding of 3D printing software settings (e.g. infill, layer height) to best create specified features and export a component's print file
Problem solve minor machine maintenance and troubleshooting problems
Operate a 3D printer to produce a successful print

f4488947-1ceb-45d9-ba4f-38fb550ea8b7.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the CAD for 3D Printing II training. Working on a guided intermediate level project, the earner demonstrated the ability to interpret critical dimensions from a technical drawing, to create 2D digital sketches and produce a printable 3D digital model.
f4488947-1ceb-45d9-ba4f-38fb550ea8b7.name: CAD for 3D Printing Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Create a 2D digital sketch and basic technical drawing of a component
Use CAD software to create an optimally oriented, printable 3D model using tools such as extrude, revolve, mirror
Prepare output files according to 3D printing and finishing specifications
Interpret critical dimensions from a technical drawing

3d53b16d-3fd8-448c-a4f3-6306b3dcd1ef.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the Functional Testing II training. Working on a guided intermediate level project, the earner of this badge gained knowledge of key functional tests; demonstrated the ability to design and align appropriate test plans to address safety requirements and design specifications; and report/interpret test results.
3d53b16d-3fd8-448c-a4f3-6306b3dcd1ef.name: Functional Testing Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Dimensionally inspect a component based on the critical dimensions from a technical drawing
Define clear and reasoned acceptance criteria for the testing plan of a component
Conduct basic functional tests for a component
Report and interpret the results of testing

fd91304e-e0eb-4ffd-83d8-d84416b78eb2.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the Post-Processing II training. Working on a guided intermediate level project, the earner of this badge gained basic knowledge of heat treatment, finishing techniques and was able to create an appropriate CAM file for a 3D printed component.
fd91304e-e0eb-4ffd-83d8-d84416b78eb2.name: Post-processing Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Remove a 3D printed component from substrate/print bed
Create an appropriate CAM file for a 3D printed component
Research the options for post processing techniques
Evaluate the quality of finished work
Adjust a 3D model to align with the chosen post-processing techniques and their constraints

d47fd454-1439-41fe-8848-071cdd5bae91.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the Project Trace & Analysis II training. Working on a guided intermediate or above level project, the earner of this badge gained knowledge of how to clearly trace and analyse an advanced manufacturing project. Using templates and defined processes, earners of this badge have learned how to set up a project, manage its digital trace, and evaluate the efficiency and effectiveness of an advanced manufacturing project.
d47fd454-1439-41fe-8848-071cdd5bae91.name: Project Trace and Analysis Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Document a design process or project using a provided framework
Apply a standardised naming convention to project files
Use technologies to manage and present digital project assets
Evaluate and document the efficiency and effectiveness of completed project within a summary report

33c75578-6e0c-4278-8a8c-797a8b72444d.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the advanced manufacturing Adaptive Design II training. Working on a guided intermediate level project, the earner demonstrated knowledge of design processes and key design considerations (e.g. features, users, risks, operational environment) and produced a suitable design solution in answer to a pre-defined problem.
33c75578-6e0c-4278-8a8c-797a8b72444d.name: Adaptive Design Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Design a component in response to a pre-defined design problem
Draw 2D sketches (hand drawn or digital) of a proposed design including important dimensions and views for manufacture
Clearly summarise a specification for a pre-defined design problem with consideration of the users’ needs
Conduct risk assessment for the design concept
Identify the relationship between design features, risks, testing and outcomes

ea13d086-97cd-4533-8d37-0257eaacf4eb.description: This micro-mode study offers an intermediate-level of understanding in the Yolŋu languages and culture of east Arnhemland. It equips you with some basic understanding of Yolŋu knowledge practice, including agreement and decision making process, and intermediate level of skills in translating, reading and writing Yolŋu texts. The completion of this study entitles you to credit transfer into Bachelor of Arts or Master of Arts at CDU.
ea13d086-97cd-4533-8d37-0257eaacf4eb.name: Intermediate Learners of Yolŋu Languages and Culture

badge_template_activities.title: 6 weeks classroom participation: Internal students – CDU Casuarina campus; External students – CDU Learnline.

3 translation tasks: 1st assignment – Translate a story written in Gupapuyŋu Dhuwala’mirri language into English; 2nd assignment – Translate an intermediate level of story written in Gupapuyŋu into English; 3rd assignment – Translate two intermediate level of stories written in Gupapuyŋu into English.

fafd1735-e2bc-42e4-a794-50fb5f261098.description: Professionals working with the Bininj peoples of West Arnhem Land can be credentialled for their language skills in Bininj Kunwok. This badge gives recognition to those who have achieved a basic understanding of Bininj language and culture, including familiarity with the skin and kinship systems, basic grammar, vocabulary and pronunciation, through participation in the Bininj Kunwok online course. This credential is authorised through CDU and the Bininj Kunwok Regional Language Centre.
fafd1735-e2bc-42e4-a794-50fb5f261098.name: Bininj Kunwok basic level

badge_template_activities.title: Oral interaction: Short conversation with native speaker – introducing self, family, asking about other person
Picture description: Ability to create short sentences about a given picture, provide in written and spoken form
Translation task: Translate a short text from Kunwinjku to English

d84596f3-170f-4f54-aab9-5c9273198298.description: Module introduces: key terminology in realist research and difference from common meanings; assumptions about nature of reality and knowledge underpinning realist evaluation, realist literature review and other realist research; key differences between realist, empiricist and constructivist philosophies of research; realist understanding of causation and heuristic for causation; differences between realist and other forms of program theory; structure of realist research and evaluation questions.
d84596f3-170f-4f54-aab9-5c9273198298.name: Introduction to Realist Philosophy of Science

alignments.name: CDU Higher Education Accreditation (AQF)
alignments.description: A rubric for assessment has been developed based on CDU standards for grading of assignments and is provided to all students.

alignments.name: Rameses Standards
alignments.description: The Rameses standards for realist evaluation and realist review, and their associated learning materials, are used as the standard for understanding of realist principles.

badge_template_activities.title: Viewing of two pre-recorded lectures: Key concepts in realist evaluation; Program theory and realist program theory.

Required reading: Gullickson, AM (2020) The whole elephant: Defining evaluation (Article); Pawson R and Tilley N, (2004), Realistic Evaluation (chapter); Westhorp (2014) Realist impact evaluation: An introduction.

Interactive workshops exploring key aspects of a realist philosophy of science. Learning activity: Writing realist questions. Participants select one program to be evaluated OR one topic to be investigated through a realist review OR one realist research topic. Participants write an overarching question and sub-questions to guide a realist evaluation or realist research.

2000 word essay. Option 1: Select issue of interest/concern in research into, or evaluation of an area of work/intended area of work. Critically analyse & explain the implications of taking a realist approach to that issue. Suggest & justify strategies you would use to overcome any difficulties. Option 2: Describe & analyse ONE debate on the implications of realist philosophy for research & evaluation relevant to your area of work/interest. Justify your own position in relation to that debate.

skills.name: Writing Realist Research Or Evaluation Questions

ac169127-4386-4cb5-9a18-4302a5890c47.description: This badge is to recognise that the student has attended the 3-day course on Microgrid Design and Optimisation. Through problem-based learning, the student demonstrated the capability to design hybrid microgrids and optimise the design using Homer Pro and Homer Grid software packages. Successfully developed a microgrid model using Homer Pro and optimised the design.
ac169127-4386-4cb5-9a18-4302a5890c47.name: Foundations of Microgrid Design and Optimisation

badge_template_activities.title: This course covers concepts in microgrid design and optimisation using the modelling software Homer Pro and Homer Grid. Students will learn fundamental aspects of the design of components of a power station that includes hybrid energy generation and energy storage hybrid microgrids as well as economic aspects for estimating costs and returns from the designed microgrid. Distinct features of Homer Pro and Homer Grid software to optimise the microgrid design will be taught.

97f23c64-40d4-4774-af2c-ee4e358c322f.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the advanced manufacturing Adaptive Design I training. Working on a guided introductory level project, the earner gained knowledge of the key concepts of the design cycle, design considerations (e.g., features, users, risks) and used this knowledge to identify a suitable design solution to a problem.
97f23c64-40d4-4774-af2c-ee4e358c322f.name: Adaptive Design Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Identify a suitable design solution in response to a design problem
Draw simple 2D drawings of the proposed solution
Use a framework to outline a specification for a design problem
Consider the needs of users in relation to the design
Identify basic hazards and risks for a component

72384a26-7854-4d5e-87d7-ae50548b06a3.description: This badge recognises practical skills in the delights of cooking Asian cuisine, achieved through hands-on experience in cooking with yeast products, making soups, entrees, main courses and desserts. The course is enjoyed by experienced cooks, and those new to cooking. It builds foundational confidence in the art of Asian cooking and is professionally assessed using competency-based assessment methods.
72384a26-7854-4d5e-87d7-ae50548b06a3.name: Asian Cookery

badge_template_activities.title: Prepare four Asian dishes using a variety of methods such as stir frying, steaming yeast buns, as well as making aromatic and distinctive Asian desserts. Create complementary sauces and marinades, cutting using fine Asian techniques and the effective use of a mortar and pestle.

63bc114e-e136-41ed-a49d-13d9311f7820.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the Post-Processing I training. Working on a guided introductory level project, the earner of this badge gained basic knowledge of finishing techniques and CAM software as used for post-processing 3D printed components.
63bc114e-e136-41ed-a49d-13d9311f7820.name: Post-processing Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Remove a 3D printed component from substrate/print bed
Demonstrate knowledge of basic post processing techniques for a 3D printed component
Communicate appropriate approach for the CNC machining of a 3D printed component

fdb1f829-43b2-488a-87e7-ca8fdc253217.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the Project Trace & Analysis I training. Working on a guided introductory level or above project, the earner of this badge gained basic knowledge of how to trace and reflect on an advanced manufacturing design project. Using templates and defined processes, earners of this badge learned the importance of consistent naming conventions, documentation and project review.
fdb1f829-43b2-488a-87e7-ca8fdc253217.name: Project Trace and Analysis Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Document a design process or project using a provided framework
Apply a naming convention to project files
Review the efficiency and effectiveness of a completed project

26c63d2d-acd7-403a-91c4-eaa362d70a6f.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the CAD for 3D Printing I training. Working on a guided introductory level project, the earner of this badge gained knowledge of the basic principles used to create simple 2D digital sketches and 3D digital models using 3D modelling software.
26c63d2d-acd7-403a-91c4-eaa362d70a6f.name: CAD for 3D Printing Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Create a 2D digital sketch of a component
Create a printable 3D computer model of a component using tools such as extrude
Prepare output files according to 3D printing and finishing specification

d77e9f98-2f50-4ea4-898a-0072382691fc.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the Functional Testing I training. Working on a guided introductory level project, the earner of this badge gained knowledge of acceptance criteria, how to conduct a basic functional test and perform a dimensional inspection of a component.
d77e9f98-2f50-4ea4-898a-0072382691fc.name: Functional Testing Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Describe basic acceptance criteria for testing of a component
Conduct a basic functional test for a component
Dimensionally inspect a component

60abc378-b1ea-4457-85a8-e0044f84f5e8.description: This unit examines the implications of a realist philosophy of science for specific methods in design, data collection, data analysis and reporting in realist evaluation. Students develop skills in developing program theory, designing realist evaluation, developing instruments, selecting samples, qualitative and quantitative analysis, and reporting in line with international standards for realist evaluation.
60abc378-b1ea-4457-85a8-e0044f84f5e8.name: Introduction to Realist Evaluation

alignments.name: CDU Higher Education Accreditation (AQF)
alignments.description: A rubric for assessment has been developed based on CDU standards for grading of assignments and is provided to all students.

alignments.name: Rameses Standards
alignments.description: International reporting and quality standards for realist evaluation will be used as tools for self-assessment of their work and as a tool for feedback from staff.

badge_template_activities.title: 5 pre-recorded lectures: Realist evaluation design; Data: Overview and quantitative data; Qualitative data and realist interviewing; Analysis, synthesis and revising program theory; Reporting realist evaluations.

Reading: Pawson and Manzano - Realist Diagnostic Workshop; Rameses Publication Standards - Realist evaluation; Rameses Quality Standards - Realist evaluation; Westhorp, G. (2008) Development of Realist Evaluation Models and Methods for use in Small-Scale Community Based Settings. Ch 4.; Manzano (2016) The craft of realist interviewing; Rameses Project II - Realist interviewing

5 interactive workshops (online or face to face) with related learning activities: Developing realist program theory; Writing key evaluation questions; Identifying data requirements; Realist interviewing; Data analysis and reporting

Option 1: Evaluation Design Report (4000-4500 words per student). Prepare an evaluation design report (equivalent to a brief research protocol or evaluation inception report). Option 2: Negotiated Assessment (4000-4500 words). Students who are developing or undertaking a realist evaluation outside of the unit of study may negotiate with the lecturer one aspect of or method for that evaluation on which to report.

054de0f6-80f9-4cad-b95b-2a5260d8c0dd.description: This unit examines the implications of a realist philosophy of science for specific methods in realist review (the realist approach to synthesis of existing evidence). Students practice skills in scoping a review, developing program theory to guide the review, developing a search strategy for evidence, extracting evidence from literature, and synthesising findings. International reporting and quality standards for realist review will be used for self-assessment and as a tool for staff feedback.
054de0f6-80f9-4cad-b95b-2a5260d8c0dd.name: Introduction to Realist Review

alignments.name: CDU Higher Education Accreditation (AQF)
alignments.description: A rubric for assessment has been developed based on CDU standards for grading of assignments and is provided to all students.

alignments.name: Rameses Standards
alignments.description: International reporting and quality standards for realist evaluation will be used as tools for self-assessment of their work and as a tool for feedback from staff.

badge_template_activities.title: Lectures: Realist Review; Data: Overview and quantitative data; Qualitative data and realist interviewing; Analysis, synthesis and revising program theory; Reporting realist reviews.

Reading: Pawson et al (2004) Realist review – an introduction; Saul et al (2013) A time responsive tool for informing policy making: rapid realist review; Booth et al (2019) Scoping and searching for realist approaches; Wong et al (2011) Policy guidance on threats to legislative interventions in public health: a realist synthesis.
Interactive workshops (online or face to face) with related learning activities: Defining the review topic; Developing a search strategy; Extracting data.

Realist Review Protocol (4000-4500 words per student). Prepare a realist review protocol (design). The design will incorporate a brief description of the research question, its policy context, the purposes to be achieved by the review, the rationale for using a realist approach, the program theory, the search process and search terms, and the data collection, extraction and analysis strategy.

skills.name: Developing Realist Theory For A Review Topic

5837324e-413a-4a8c-8f24-cfc4736c26ab.description: Recipients of this credential are senior Indigenous researchers with significant experience in culturally responsive community-based research. They have a history of successful work on research projects, and mobilise strong cultural authority and leadership when working collaboratively with university or other research organisations. They have demonstrated high level skills in bilingual and inter-cultural facilitation, ethical research practice, research co-design and public communication.
5837324e-413a-4a8c-8f24-cfc4736c26ab.name: Senior Indigenous Community-based Researcher

badge_template_activities.title: Creation of a portfolio that details at least three completed research projects. The portfolio includes a personal profile, project descriptions, identification of skills practiced, project photos (if available), reflection on the research process and outcomes.

0753f3e3-e988-4ffd-ad0a-1e035593ef67.description: The earner of this badge has successfully completed the requirements of the 3D Printing I training. Working on a guided introductory level project, the earner of this badge gained knowledge of the features, parameters and material considerations in 3D printing. The earner developed basic skills in slicing software used for 3D printers and was able to assess a designed part to ensure it fits within printer constraints.
0753f3e3-e988-4ffd-ad0a-1e035593ef67.name: 3D Printing Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Assess a designed part to ensure it fits within printer constraints
Identify possible print issues through inspection of a print preview or simulation
Use the basic 3D printing software settings to produce and export a component's print file
Demonstrate knowledge of how to successfully print a 3D component

cea380ba-d6c7-40a5-8027-1d41d46b7041.description: This badge recognises practical skills in the art of basic cake decorating, achieved through hands-on experience in decorative chocolate work, cream decorating, creating celebration cakes and other decorations, as well as baking sponges. The course provides people who are new to baking with experience in cake decorating. The course increases the skills of participants in decorating cakes, builds confidence and is professionally assessed using competency-based assessment methods.
cea380ba-d6c7-40a5-8027-1d41d46b7041.name: Cake Decorating

badge_template_activities.title: Bake a variety of sponges with commercial equipment and decorate with creams, fillings, fruit and chocolate garnishes, and creative piping and writing.

9fd4f337-8600-4833-bdb9-e16c51e4f87c.description: This badge acknowledges achievement of skills in community-based research work. Earners of this credential have participated in one or more research projects in their home communities, working in collaboration with a university-based staff member. Earners will have completed on-the-job training and participated in collaborative research work. They will have demonstrated skills in bilingual and intercultural research facilitation, ethical research practice and data collection.
9fd4f337-8600-4833-bdb9-e16c51e4f87c.name: Indigenous Community-based Researcher

badge_template_activities.title: On-the-job training about designing research projects, interviewing, video and audio recording, research ethics and presenting research outcomes.
Demonstrate research skills that are assessed by an appropriate senior Indigenous person and CDU staff member.
Creation of a  research portfolio that showcases involvement in one or more research projects.

acf578b3-e01f-4776-b22c-6e4bd670d5e5.description: This credential acknowledges the participation and contribution made by an Indigenous community-based researcher to a collaborative research project. Earners will have worked with CDU staff on one or more research projects. They will have received introductory training in research ethics, and been given the opportunity to learn about research from experienced community and university-based researchers.
acf578b3-e01f-4776-b22c-6e4bd670d5e5.name: Indigenous Research Collaborator

badge_template_activities.title: Creation of research portfolio which showcases their collaboration in one or more research projects.
On the job demonstration of research collaboration skills will be assessed by an appropriate senior Indigenous person and CDU staff member.

3eca7937-ea42-4280-aeaa-feeb0733973b.description: This badge recognises completion of a course to teach and communicate scholarly information more effectively. The course covered: relevant advances in psychology, communication, and technology; writing and to speaking persuasively and professionally; utilising tools that enhance the engagement; learning, innovation; and developing suitable networks.
3eca7937-ea42-4280-aeaa-feeb0733973b.name: Persuasive Teaching and Communication

badge_template_activities.title: Using the principles about written communication and persuasion, learners corrected a document that  someone else had written.  To pass this assignment, learners needed to apply at least 20 distinct principles.

Using the principles about student engagement, learning, memory, creativity, social skills, and personal brands,  learners developed a video—or series of videos—that explained some of their research interests.
Short multiple-choice test  to assess the knowledge learned during the course.

03d16407-06d5-4125-b339-7e0397afee17.description: This badge recognises completion of a course that develops skills and knowledge in conducting research with diverse populations, including Indigenous communities, other nationalities, and vulnerable individuals. This includes: research paradigms and methods; supervision of diverse populations; ethical issues that arise when conducting research with diverse populations; cultural competence and cultural humility; and opportunities to collaborate with diverse populations.
03d16407-06d5-4125-b339-7e0397afee17.name: Research with diverse populations

badge_template_activities.title: Develop a research proposal using your knowledge of research paradigms, research methods, and research ethics that are applicable to diverse populations. The research proposal should comprise at least 2000 words and utilise at least 10 distinct principles you learned from the course.
Develop some resources—such as guidelines or videos—that other researchers could use when conducting research with diverse populations.
Short multiple-choice test to assesses the knowledge learned during the course.

77bbd4f4-0c6c-4320-bb88-f4e7a0de48e2.description: Suitable for all levels of ability, these workshops explore the benefits of combining Art with Mindfulness and Yoga. The course is created for health professionals, artists, and educators. The themes for the three workshops are 1) Finding Balance, 2) Developing Peace and 3) Growing Harmony. Each workshop involves the creation of a personal piece of art, exploration of yoga and mindfulness exercises connecting mind, body, and breath. Your tutor Anne-Marie Cullinan is an experienced art teacher.
77bbd4f4-0c6c-4320-bb88-f4e7a0de48e2.name: Art and Yoga Workshops

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a badge for all three workshops. A certificate of participation will be provided if you attend only one session. The total commitment to earn a badge will be 9 hours of participation over 2-3 days.
Complete the art activities presented. These may vary.
Survey reflection of experience.

00d8880e-4383-41ad-9a01-419f9959f05b.description: Suitable for all levels of ability, botanical artist and tutor Anastasia Maximova facilitates a two-day workshop to make a connection with native flora of the Northern Territory. This extends knowledge and understanding of local flora. The enhancement of observation, drawing and watercolour painting skills will help students from any area of study find a creative output and develop a deeper understanding of botanical art.
00d8880e-4383-41ad-9a01-419f9959f05b.name: Botanical Art Workshop

badge_template_activities.title: Earn a badge for participation in two workshops. A certificate of participation will be provided if you attend only one session.
Complete the art activities presented. These may vary.

c2110ab0-822b-44b7-b2a1-0edd58c63fd8.description: This course focuses on developing fluency in the Greek language for everyday communication, both within the large Greek community in Australia and when visiting Greece as a tourist. Students are encouraged to use the language in class, with friends and in Greek shops. The successful completion of this digital badge, along with “Conversational Greek – Step 2”, will be equivalent to HEL261 Greek Language 3 or IAS403 Independent Studies.
c2110ab0-822b-44b7-b2a1-0edd58c63fd8.name: Conversational Greek – Step 1

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this credit, participants need to complete a 6-week, online certification course. They are required to complete their certification by creating two VoiceThread assignments and a VoiceThread presentation, demonstrating basic knowledge in using the Greek language (oral & written) in every day communicative activities.

ce8e7c80-16db-46aa-8ec6-711db08faae0.description: This course will equip you with introductory knowledge about project management, including selecting and initiating a technical project. This course is free, self-paced and fully online for prospective postgraduate students of Engineering and IT. Upon successful completion of this course, you can request credit for the first assessment item of the unit PRT551 Project Management, Risk and Reliability.
ce8e7c80-16db-46aa-8ec6-711db08faae0.name: Developing a Technical Business Case

badge_template_activities.title: Completion of three learning modules and learning activities: Introduction to Project Management, Selecting Projects and Initiating Projects.
Online quiz. Students must score more than 50% to earn the badge.

d42831aa-1f79-4a62-805a-6dfe4565b05f.description: This course covers broad aspects of networking, including architectures, models, protocols and networking elements. Students will learn to build a simple local area network and troubleshoot network problems.
d42831aa-1f79-4a62-805a-6dfe4565b05f.name: Foundations of Computer Networking

badge_template_activities.title: Critically analyse the operation of data networks.
Implement a small-switched network and a small-routed network.

Implement an IP addressing scheme to meet network requirements for a small branch office using the fundamentals of Ethernet LANs, WANs and IP routing; CLI and switches; and subnetting, particularly VLSM.
Exam.

7c419ca8-f4a2-415b-b0cd-3951fc41a3c0.description: This course provides an overview of the IT discipline, including historical perspectives, fundamental concepts of computation, and relationships with other computing disciplines. Specific learning includes computer and systems architecture, specific to services and capabilities IT infrastructure solutions provide in organisational context; skills to troubleshoot hardware problems for computers; and an introduction to web development technologies, including basic XHTML and CSS.
7c419ca8-f4a2-415b-b0cd-3951fc41a3c0.name: Foundations of Computing

badge_template_activities.title: SharePoint Development Plan + SharePoint, including: create and share sites; move/copy/share documents; set-up permissions; recover deleted documents; create custom permissions (site and library level); create a library, versioning, filtering, create filtered views, checkout, library settings; overall MS applications.
Report outlining SharePoint as relates to one of three presented scenarios. Report to include visuals (images) of proposed SharePoint.

d02854ac-84c8-4eb9-bf76-cf83521488d0.description: This course gives an overview of securing an organisation’s business assets based on a risk management approach. You will develop an understanding of the risks and defence mechanisms for network, application, physical, and wireless security; modern cryptography and its application in cyber security, footprinting, enumeration and social engineering aspects; wireless networks, desktop, and operating system vulnerabilities; and the steps and process of network defence.
d02854ac-84c8-4eb9-bf76-cf83521488d0.name: Foundations of Cyber Security

badge_template_activities.title: Plan for organisations information security through policies, technologies and risk management.
Evaluate operating systems and network level vulnerabilities and formulate appropriate countermeasures.
Apply effective communication methods to convey ideas and principles.
Presentation with written report.

c9371574-bfa5-4c90-bc99-fe8a50627109.description: This course introduces foundational concepts and skills in data science and statistics, including important elements in a modern data analytics ecosystem; how data science solutions are deployed in response to real-world scenarios; and ethical approaches to contemporary issues. You will learn descriptive and inferential statistics, data pre-processing techniques, basic machine learning models, and effective data visualisations using established data science platforms and analytics tools.
c9371574-bfa5-4c90-bc99-fe8a50627109.name: Foundations of Data Science

badge_template_activities.title: Profile selected dataset using descriptive and inferential statistics techniques.
Utilise essential data wrangling techniques (3 essential data science skills following Drew Conway’s Venn Diagram).
Recorded (audio) verbal report.

531c5161-548f-4261-94fc-d9fc1124038d.description: This course will provide students with an introduction to a first programming language, including basic control structures common across languages; and concepts and technologies associated with platform-independent, object-oriented programming. Students will learn to combine practical experience in using professional standard Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) to create applications with associated theoretical concepts.
531c5161-548f-4261-94fc-d9fc1124038d.name: Foundations of Programming

badge_template_activities.title: Successful coding reflecting data types and expressions, strings and files, functions and dictionaries, recursive functions, GitHub and Slack.

ac5e99ee-3fcc-4c6b-96d7-28387218ff42.description: This course provides a basic introduction to physical, chemical and biological processes within the context of current environmental issues. It explores the physical basis of the greenhouse effect, role of greenhouse gas emissions, global warming trajectories and climate change ramifications. This provides a basis for understanding the greenhouse issue, climate change consequences, sea level rise and other effects, and examines the influence of rising temperature and heat in urban environments.
ac5e99ee-3fcc-4c6b-96d7-28387218ff42.name: Greenhouse and Global Warming

badge_template_activities.title: Answer multiple-choice questions to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of mechanisms and factors associated with greenhouse and global warming.
Critically evaluate data and information, graphing exercise.

Investigation and communication of findings – heat and the greenhouse effect. Develop a video recording to demonstrate knowledge of heat and how to measure it, and ways in which heat is gained and lost.

23005312-8f30-44bf-ad59-23d7ddb55736.description: This short course will enable HealthLAB staff, students and volunteers to develop competency in communicating health messages in remote communities in an understandable form to people of a range of ages and levels of health literacy and English literacy. Training will be delivered before and during HealthLABs where course participants will run a health-themed station and deliver health messages and respond to questions using strength-based language and ensuring a culturally safe space.
23005312-8f30-44bf-ad59-23d7ddb55736.name: Health Communication in Remote Communities

badge_template_activities.title: Activity 1 involves learning and demonstrating written knowledge of each competency in a workbook. Complete six core units and 1 elective unit in the workbook.

Activity 2 includes running a HealthLAB station to deliver health messaging and respond to HealthLAB participant questions. Respond to questions in the workbook to self-report application of knowledge. Supervisors will also report ways that the student demonstrated competencies.

d8f67073-f7a2-4d65-b107-b02b29eef06a.description: This badge is awarded to Indigenous cultural workers who are bilingually proficient and work with languages—in teaching, in developing teaching resources, and in culturally researching and articulating the development of Indigenous languages in their communities. Awardees are qualified to undertake language teaching and research in the cultural development of languages under elder knowledge authority while engaging with non-Indigenous partners and organisations.
d8f67073-f7a2-4d65-b107-b02b29eef06a.name: Indigenous Community-Based Language Worker

badge_template_activities.title: You are required to attend a language work induction meeting and identification of supervising Elder Indigenous authority.
You are required to create a language worker profile detailing who you are, and your previous work (including bilingual experience).

You are required to facilitate one or more language teaching-learning episodes and generation of portfolio of appropriate language-teaching pedagogical materials; or generation of a portfolio demonstrating successful preparation of one or more types of community language support and development resources.

You are required to demonstrate your understanding of what community language support and development work involves, and your capacity to operate bilingually and biculturally in teaching-learning and language research and documentation situations.

b2982ce1-9aad-438d-86c5-445782893269.description: This badge is awarded to Indigenous cultural workers who are bilingually proficient and work with languages—in teaching, in developing teaching resources, and in culturally researching and articulating the development of Indigenous languages in their communities. Awardees are qualified to undertake language teaching and research in the cultural development of languages under elder knowledge authority while engaging with non-Indigenous partners and organisations.
b2982ce1-9aad-438d-86c5-445782893269.name: Indigenous Community-Based Language Worker Collaborator

badge_template_activities.title: You are required to attend a language work induction meeting and identification of supervising Elder Indigenous authority.
You are required to create a language worker profile detailing who you are, and your previous work (including bilingual experience)
You are required to participate in one or more collaborative language projects undertaken under Elder Authority with local language workers and CDU staff.

f85478fb-0652-473a-92ab-a229cfd9abd7.description: This foundational language instruction requested by the Australian Defence Force (ADF) will be delivered by CDU Indonesian language instructors. This offering is step 1 of 4 proposed offerings. The successful completion of all four steps will be equal to IAS161 Language Level 1 (Indonesian). Volume of learning in Step 1 includes 18 hours in class, plus 18 hours of self-directed learning and study (this includes work on assessment items).
f85478fb-0652-473a-92ab-a229cfd9abd7.name: Indonesian Language Training for the Military Step 1

badge_template_activities.title: Regular attendance at class and completion of self-directed learning online. Volume of learning in Step 1 includes 18 hours in class, plus 18 hours of self-directed learning and study (this includes work on assessment items).
Successful completion of assessment items. This delivery includes: three written assessment items and three oral assessment items.

164faf0c-706a-4413-9c46-e75574a7189e.description: This course focuses on developing fluency in the Greek language for everyday communication, both within the large Greek community in Australia and when visiting Greece as a tourist. Students are encouraged to use the language in class, with friends and in Greek shops. The successful completion of this digital badge, along with “Introduction to Greek Language and Culture – Step 2”, will be equivalent to HEL161 Greek Language 1.
164faf0c-706a-4413-9c46-e75574a7189e.name: Introduction to Greek Language and Culture – Step 1

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this credit, participants need to complete a 6-week, online certification course. They are required to complete their certification by creating two VoiceThread assignments and a VoiceThread presentation, demonstrating basic knowledge in using the Greek language (oral & written) in every day communicative activities.

fb842189-3d54-48d1-a61d-a25a8fa584ae.description: Underpinning the on-ground fire management requires the use of spatial data to inform planning and implementation of prescribed burning and bushfire response. Being able to produce maps that tell you where you have burnt in the past and where a fire might burn in the future can inform your strategies for strengthening fire breaks & responding to fires. We will work through exercises that will introduce you to spatial data and how you can use them for fire management in the field.
fb842189-3d54-48d1-a61d-a25a8fa584ae.name: QGIS for North Australian Fire Managers

badge_template_activities.title: Competency in navigating QGIS to their operational areas of interest and overlaying key (NAFI) fire information datasets via the NAFI plugin. A map export of the region with fire information will be required.
Building a map of fire spread landscape layers and illustrating how this would be used to guide mitigation burns. A map export of the region with fire information will be required.
To complete the requirements for this offering, participants must complete the in-person training component.

20dd8884-56c3-46ae-824a-092c07fa5d55.description: This micro-credential introduces the key elements of realist interviewing. It explains how a realist understanding of causation shapes realist interviewing, and the ways in which realist interviews differ from other forms of interviewing. It describes how to ethically design, conduct, document, analyse and store data from realist interviews, including considerations for particular population groups, and develops key skills in realist interviewing.
20dd8884-56c3-46ae-824a-092c07fa5d55.name: Realist Interviewing

alignments.name: CDU Higher Education Accreditation (AQF)
alignments.description: A rubric for assessment has been developed based on CDU standards for grading of assignments and is provided to all students.

alignments.name: Rameses Standards
alignments.description: International reporting standards for realist evaluation will be used as tools for self-assessment of work and as a tool for feedback from staff.

badge_template_activities.title: A two day face-to-face workshop provides lectures, introduction to the skills involved, and practice in applying skills.
Reading: Chapter 6,. Pawson & Tilley 1997 Realistic Evaluation, Ch 6; Manzano, A 2016 The Craft of Interviewing in Realist Evaluation. Ana Manzano.

The assessment requires the completion of three tasks: Design, document and justify an interview sample in relation to a particular program theory and develop an interview guide; Conduct and record an interview using the interview guide; Write a brief critical reflection on the interview including changes that may be required for future interviews.

a7734711-49b9-43dd-bb10-b73a18526da4.description: This badge recognises completion course that develops skills and knowledge to fund a research career. Skills include a range of research methods to extend consulting opportunities; attracting research funding, such as grants and fellowships; translating research into commercial opportunities; and improving your track record.
a7734711-49b9-43dd-bb10-b73a18526da4.name: Research funding, consulting, and commercialisation

badge_template_activities.title: Develop a webpage that promotes your research skills. To pass this assignment, the webpage should highlight at least 10 research skills the learner has developed.

Construct a plan that specifies the activities you plan to implement to secure a major fellowship, grant, or commercial opportunity. To pass this assignment, learners need to refer to at least 20 activities they will undertake to improve your track record.
Short multiple-choice test  to assess the knowledge learned during the course.

f83a5685-9598-47ae-8fb3-be7a13d10d36.description: This badge is awarded to Indigenous cultural workers who are bilingually proficient and work with languages—in teaching, in developing teaching resources, and in culturally researching and articulating the development of Indigenous languages in their communities. Awardees are qualified to undertake language teaching and research in the cultural development of languages under elder knowledge authority while engaging with non-Indigenous partners and organisations.
f83a5685-9598-47ae-8fb3-be7a13d10d36.name: Senior Indigenous Community-Based Language Worker

badge_template_activities.title: You are required to document who you are, your connection to particular people-places, and your previous experience and work with community languages.
You are required to present examples of 4 (or more) completed projects, including a brief description of the outcomes of each project.
You are required to demonstrate your understanding of different language philosophies in modern life. How different visions of what languages are in differing situations are important.
You are required to display outputs from at least 4 projects (e.g. video, audio recording, PowerPoint presentation, written report, etc.).

88b8cc6b-3a02-4311-bf35-a18dbb8f8289.description: Indigenous rangers will learn to use camera traps to responsibly collect useful and useable data to monitor significant species on country. Training will be delivered on the job through collaborative research projects or monitoring programs under Elder authorisation, so rangers can use camera traps as a tool to support their caring for country work. This micro-credential is supported by the Healthy Country training program, which is delivered collaboratively by CDU, CSIRO and NAILSMA.
88b8cc6b-3a02-4311-bf35-a18dbb8f8289.name: Site Survey Using Camera Traps

badge_template_activities.title: Activity 1 includes collaborating with Traditional Owners to: ensure the right people are present and have provided authorisation for camera traps to be used on their country; and discuss and agree on rules for camera trap use in the area to be surveyed.

Activity 2 includes working with a technical trainer or competent land management practitioner through four skill units: 1) culturally safe use of camera traps; 2) choose sites to install camera traps; 3) set up cameras for monitoring; and 4) install cameras on country to practically demonstrate responsible and confidant use of camera traps to survey a monitoring site.

Activity 3 is submitting a screenshot of a photo from the camera taken during the walk test activity to show correct set up and to make sure data will be collected and the camera will 'see country' while people are not there.

cf8a616a-7a1f-4cb9-962b-ee0fd5909d4b.description: Indigenous rangers will learn to use drones to responsibly collect useful and useable data to monitor healthy country values. Training will be delivered on the job through collaborative research projects or monitoring programs with a technical trainer and under Elder authorisation, so rangers can use drones as a tool to support their caring for Country work. This micro-credential is supported by the Healthy Country training program, which is delivered collaboratively by CDU, CSIRO and NAILSMA.
cf8a616a-7a1f-4cb9-962b-ee0fd5909d4b.name: Site Survey Using Drones

badge_template_activities.title: Activity 1 includes collaborating with Traditional Owners to: ensure the right people are present and have provided authorisation for drones to be flown on their Country; map the area to be surveyed with Traditional Owners, including areas that can be flown over and areas that cannot be flown over; and discuss and agree on rules for drone use in the area to be surveyed.

Activity 2 includes working with a RePL licenced technical trainer through six skill units: 1) culturally safe drone use; 2) launch and land a drone; 3) fly drone in a controlled way; 4) take photos of country from the air with the drone; 5) set up survey area in drone control app; and 6) collect monitoring data of survey site using drone.
Activity 3 is submitting a photo of the map from the drone survey

539e38db-a80f-4096-af23-b4230554aa4f.description: The Vice-Chancellor’s Awards for Teaching Excellence 2022 recognise CDU’s outstanding teachers who have demonstrated excellent leadership through sustained commitment to innovation, delivery of quality teaching and sustained dedication to improve the student experience and learning outcomes for students.
539e38db-a80f-4096-af23-b4230554aa4f.name: Vice-Chancellor’s Award for Early Career Teaching Excellence 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Approaches to teaching and/or the support of learning that influence, motivate and inspire students to learn.
Development of curricula, resources or services that reflect a command of the field.
Effective assessment practices that bring about improvements in student learning, may have a focus on academic integrity or digital solutions, or any assessment strategies that bring about change.
Innovation or leadership that has influenced and enhanced learning and teaching and/or student experience.

0b127e2f-9782-4650-a0ed-3c540ce076ea.description: The Vice-Chancellor’s Awards for Teaching Excellence 2022 recognise CDU’s outstanding teachers who have demonstrated excellent leadership through sustained commitment to innovation, delivery of quality teaching and sustained dedication to improve the student experience and learning outcomes for students.
0b127e2f-9782-4650-a0ed-3c540ce076ea.name: Vice-Chancellor’s Award for Excellence in Teaching Support 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Positive impact on student learning, student engagement or the overall student experience: Extent to which the program targets identified needs and directly or indirectly enhances student learning, student engagement and/or the overall student experience of tertiary education.

Recognition from colleagues, the institution, and/or the broader community: Extent to which the program has led to widespread benefits for students, staff, the institution, and/or other institutions, consistent with the purpose of the program.

Creativity, imagination and/or innovation: Innovation or leadership that has influenced and enhanced learning and teaching and/or student experience in traditional learning environments and/or technology-based developments.
Drawn on scholarly literature: Extent to which the program has clear objectives and systematic approaches to coordination, implementation and evaluation.

965af472-946a-41a3-af19-e635ad7502a9.description: The Vice-Chancellor’s Awards for Teaching Excellence 2022 recognise CDU’s outstanding teachers who have demonstrated excellent leadership through sustained commitment to innovation, delivery of quality teaching and sustained dedication to improve the student experience and learning outcomes for students.
965af472-946a-41a3-af19-e635ad7502a9.name: Vice-Chancellor’s Award for First Nations Teaching Excellence 2022

Development of curricula, resources or services that reflect a command of the field.
Effective assessment practices that bring about improvements in student learning, may have a focus on academic integrity or digital solutions, or any assessment strategies that bring about change.
Innovation or leadership that has influenced and enhanced learning and teaching and/or student experience.

29e7a7a9-77f3-403a-89e7-806954b08a27.name: Vice-Chancellor’s Award for Higher Education Teaching Excellence 2022

Effective assessment practices that bring about improvements in student learning, may have a focus on academic integrity or digital solutions, or any assessment strategies that bring about change.

447db792-5bec-4c7f-82e4-f11871f9d141.name: Vice-Chancellor’s Award for Higher Education Teaching - Highly Commended 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Approaches to teaching and/or the support of learning that influence, motivate and inspire students to learn.
Development of curricula, resources or services that reflect a command of the field.
Effective assessment practices that bring about improvements in student learning, may have a focus on academic integrity or digital solutions, or any assessment strategies that bring about change.
Innovation or leadership that has influenced and enhanced learning and teaching and/or student experience.

0764fdea-5bfe-4117-bf26-496739b8f4b3.description: The Vice-Chancellor’s Awards for Teaching Excellence 2022 recognise CDU’s outstanding teachers who have demonstrated excellent leadership through sustained commitment to innovation, delivery of quality teaching and sustained dedication to improve the student experience and learning outcomes for students.
0764fdea-5bfe-4117-bf26-496739b8f4b3.name: Vice-Chancellor’s Award for VET Teaching Excellence 2022

badge_template_activities.title: Excellence and initiative.
Learner needs and focus.
Commitment to VET teaching and learning.
Links with industry and community.
